page.title: 05FARMING.
page.content: On Friday,5th July we interviewed {MR COX} of{TROYTOWN FARM, PUDDLETOWN about his farm.We asked him if his farm was a typical Dorset farm.He thought so because his farm has dairy and beef cattle and arable crops.He also said he thought his 900 acre farm was large for the area mainly because it is linked to another family farm in Puddletown. The soil on his land is made up of sand,gravel and chalk.He grows grass, wheat,barley and some kale for the cows. The machinery is typical of a Dorset farm having changed little over recent years. He has got 110 cows and 200 young stock.Eden Vale takes the milk to Milborne St. Andrew and from there goes to London.He produces 450 gallons of milk a day.
